cab.content: 6oSJCR EJP. CP.,522 (29)COPY NOCABINET,THE SINGAPORE BASE.PARAPHRASE TELEGRAM from trie Governor-General of New Zealand to the Secretary of State for Dominion Affairs. (Dated 15th November. Received Dominions Office 9c22 a,m. 13th November, 1929).(Circulated by the Secretary of State for Dominion Affairs with, reference to Cabinet. 47(29), Conclusion 7).IMMEDIATE.No. 137, SecreteYour telegram Circular Bo 171 of 12th. November. Following from Prime Minister. Begins :-The reply proposed to Parliamentary question appears to indicate a die tinet change of policy in regard to the Singapore Base and to Involve a departure from the principles of consultation expressly affirmed in your Secret telegram No. 80 of 30th July.H.M. Government in New Zealand adhere to the attitude outlined in my Secret telsgram No. 78 of 15th July and feel justified in expressing their regret that a decision of moment to New Zealand has apparently been taken by H.M. Government in the United Kingdom without prior consultation with the New Zealand Government.H.M. Government in the Commonwealth, of Australia are being advised of the contents of this telegram. Ends.4 DoO. Telegram No. 481(29).2 Whitehall Gardens, S.W..1. 13th November, 1929.
